text.0: ICYMI:  A Nigerian journalist named Taiwo Adebulu won the 2020 African fact-checking awards. Click on the link to read about his win:  https://t.co/2lYS3roCU3 #DubawaChecks
text.1: A video was posted on social media with the claim that the ASUU chairman was slapped during a meeting between ASUU and the federal government. This claim is false. The video was from the Edo State House of Assembly in 2017. Read here: https://t.co/L4XrI6hlnl #DubawaChecks
text.2: The claim that Queen Elizabeth II wrote a condolence letter to the Nigerian government over the death of President Buhari is false. Read the facts here: https://t.co/tkeqcLN12B #DubawaChecks #FactCheck
text.3:
"The culture of giving car gifts to judges has often created a sort of public confusion in recent times with respect to the impartiality and independence of the judiciary."

Are car gifts to judges constitutional? Here are the facts: https://t.co/kSsCAMu5HA #DubawaChecks
